title: 111_s2901
content:
The "Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009" establishes the Government-Wide Acquisition Management Fellows Program under the Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act. The Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 establishes a government-wide acquisition management fellows program to invest in the long-term improvement of the Federal acquisition workforce by developing new leaders with government-wide perspective, recruiting individuals with outstanding skills and offering advancement opportunities. The Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 establishes a program for developing new leaders in Federal acquisition through contracts with universities for training and curriculum including rotational assignments at executive agencies. The program established by the Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 covers various aspects of acquisition planning, cost estimation, contract administration, training courses for contracting officers, transparency, accountability, integrity in contracting, and other necessary education. Priority is given to employment opportunities. The Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 prioritizes graduates of the program for hiring in the acquisition field at GS-12, 13, or 14 levels. Hiring must comply with merit system principles and preference eligible rights. The Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 prioritizes program graduates for hiring in the acquisition field at GS-12, 13, or 14 levels. The program limits the total number of participants to 200 annually, with specific participant quotas for each year. The Administrator is responsible for program management, participant selection, and placement upon graduation. Qualified universities with expertise in Federal Government acquisition administer the program independently. The program requires participants to commit to federal employment in acquisition for a minimum term, with the Administrator overseeing career development and necessary adjustments. Participants who do not complete the program must reimburse funds. The OFPP Acquisition Fellows Program requires participants to commit to federal employment in acquisition for a minimum term. If candidates do not complete the program, they must reimburse the Federal Government for funds received. Additionally, a fund called the OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund is established to cover program expenses like tuition and materials. The OFPP Acquisition Fellows Program covers academic expenses, room and board, travel, stipends, program administration, and other necessary expenses. The Fund consists of appropriated amounts for program funding. The Government-wide acquisition management fellows program under section 45 of the Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act requires the Administrator to submit an initial report within 120 days of enactment and annual reports thereafter to congressional committees detailing program activities and budget needs. The Administrator must submit reports to congressional committees on the Government-wide acquisition management fellows program, detailing program activities, effectiveness in meeting objectives, and any recommendations for legislative or administrative action. The appropriate congressional committees are defined as the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs and the Committee on Governmental Affairs. Authorization of Appropriations for the OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund: 
- For fiscal year 2011: $16,000,000
- For fiscal year 2012: $32,000,000
- For fiscal year 2013: $48,000,000
